00021 #ifndef GUIHELPER_H

00024 #include <QSlider>
00025 #include <QScrollArea>
00026 #include <QEvent>
00027 #include <stdio.h>
00028 
00029 class QScrollAreaExt : public QScrollArea
00030 {
00031    Q_OBJECT
00032 
00033 public:
00034    QScrollAreaExt(QWidget * parent = 0) : QScrollArea(parent) {}
00035 protected:
00036     //virtual void paintEvent(QPaintEvent *event);
00037    virtual void focusInEvent ( QFocusEvent * event ) {printf("QScrollAreaExt focus in %p\n",this);}
00038    virtual void focusOutEvent ( QFocusEvent * event ) {printf("QScrollAreaExt focus out %p\n",this);}
00039    //virtual void wheelEvent(QWheelEvent *evt) {printf("QScrollAreaExt::wheelEvent\n"); QScrollArea::wheelEvent(evt);}
00040 
00041    virtual void wheelEvent(QWheelEvent *evt) {printf("QScrollAreaExt::wheelEvent %p\n",this);}    // This is important: it avoids the wheel event to be dispatched to the scrollbar, and thus the scrollarea to scroll when the mouse is in the scope widget
00042 
00043    virtual bool eventFilter(QObject *o, QEvent *e) {printf("QScrollAreaExt::eventFilter %p. Object %p eventtype %d\n",this,o,e->type());
00044       //if(e->type()==QEvent::FocusOut) {printf("filtering out focusout\n"); return true;}
00045       //if(e->type()==QEvent::FocusIn) {printf("filtering out focusin\n"); return true;}
00046       return QScrollArea::eventFilter(o,e);
00047    }
00048 
00049 
00050 };

00060 class QSliderExt : public QSlider

00067    ~QSliderExt();

00071    virtual void scrollRight();
